msg_ui_tips_HOWTO_01_text_01:
You can press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]X Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to open the main menu.

Select the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Save [VAR COLOR(0000)]option from this menu to save all
the progress you’ve made on your adventure so far.

When you open up your Bag, you’ll find some
[VAR COLOR(0006)]Key Items[VAR COLOR(0000)] inside, including your [VAR COLOR(0006)]Adventure Guide[VAR COLOR(0000)].

Check it out whenever you want to review handy tips
like these that you receive along your adventure!
msg_ui_tips_YMAP_01_text_01:
The handy Rotom Phone is a popular item
used throughout the Paldea region!

Adding apps to it gives a Trainer access
to a variety of useful functions.
msg_ui_tips_YMAP_01_text_02:
Using the map app, you can find useful information
about the Paldea region. If you move the map cursor
over your own icon and then move the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Right Stick[VAR COLOR(0000)]
from side to side, you’ll rotate your own view along
with the map. Handy for getting yourself oriented!
msg_ui_tips_YMAP_01_text_03:
You can use the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Left Stick[VAR COLOR(0000)] to move the magnifying
glass around the map and find locations.
Select a location by pressing the [VAR COLOR(0006)]A Button[VAR COLOR(0000)],
and you can set it as your next destination.
msg_ui_tips_YMAP_01_text_05:
The [VAR COLOR(0006)]Flying Taxi[VAR COLOR(0000)] service can take you to [VAR COLOR(0006)]some places[VAR COLOR(0000)]
you’ve visited before. Places that you can fly to are
indicated with a [VAR COLOR(0006)]feather mark[VAR COLOR(0000)]. Try taking a flight!
msg_ui_tips_POKEDEX_01_text_01:
Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]− Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to open the Pokédex
app on your Rotom Phone in a flash!

You can also navigate to your Pokédex by
pressing the [VAR COLOR(0006)]X Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] from the map app.
msg_ui_tips_POKEDEX_02_text_01:
[VAR COLOR(0006)]Battle[VAR COLOR(0000)] or [VAR COLOR(0006)]catch[VAR COLOR(0000)] Pokémon to compile volumes in your
Pokédex app—with fancier covers for Pokémon you’ve
caught. Open up your Pokédex to view all the volumes
you’ve collected on a digital shelf and check out what
rewards you can earn by pressing the [VAR COLOR(0006)]X Button[VAR COLOR(0000)]!
msg_ui_tips_POKEDEX_02_text_02:
Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]+ Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] when looking at a Pokémon you’ve
registered in your Pokédex, and you can check that
Pokémon’s [VAR COLOR(0006)]habitat[VAR COLOR(0000)] to learn more about where they can
be found and when they’re active. Explore different
areas as you adventure, and meet tons of Pokémon!
msg_ui_tips_BOX_01_text_01:
You can keep six Pokémon in your party at once.
Any other Pokémon can be sent to your Pokémon
Boxes for safekeeping.

From the main menu, you can select your [VAR COLOR(0006)]Boxes[VAR COLOR(0000)]
to open them up. From there, choose Pokémon
to swap in and out of your current team.
msg_ui_tips_POKEGETTUTORIAL_01_text_01:
You can try to catch a wild Pokémon you are battling
by pressing the [VAR COLOR(0006)]X Button [VAR COLOR(0000)]and throwing a Poké Ball.
msg_ui_tips_POKEGETTUTORIAL_01_text_04:
When you’re having a hard time catching a Pokémon,
try to [VAR COLOR(0006)]deal damage[VAR COLOR(0000)] to it before throwing another Poké
Ball. That should give you a better chance of success!
msg_ui_tips_POKEBATTLE_01_text_01:
The Pokémon you see wandering around in tall grass,
caves, and elsewhere are [VAR COLOR(0006)]wild Pokémon[VAR COLOR(0000)].

When you run into a wild Pokémon,
a Pokémon battle will begin!
msg_ui_tips_POKEBATTLE_01_text_02:
You can also start a battle by looking toward a wild
Pokémon and [VAR COLOR(0006)]throwing one of your Poké Balls[VAR COLOR(0000)] at it
by using the [VAR COLOR(0006)]ZR Button[VAR COLOR(0000)]! Try this tactic out to battle
Pokémon that are up in trees or flying in the sky!
msg_ui_tips_LETSGO_01_text_01:
Pressing the [VAR COLOR(0006)]R Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] is a quick and easy way to tell
your [VAR COLOR(0006)]lead Pokémon[VAR COLOR(0000)], “All right, buddy—[VAR COLOR(0006)]Let’s Go![VAR COLOR(0000)]”
Once you give the go-ahead, your Pokémon will
set out on its own to [VAR COLOR(0006)]battle [VAR COLOR(0000)]nearby Pokémon
or [VAR COLOR(0006)]pick up items[VAR COLOR(0000)] it finds in the area.
msg_ui_tips_LETSGO_01_text_02:
When your Pokémon is low on energy—which happens
when its HP is low—it won’t be able to go exploring
on its own. So if your Pokémon gets [VAR COLOR(0006)]weak[VAR COLOR(0000)], try to
[VAR COLOR(0006)]heal[VAR COLOR(0000)] it up with a Potion or some other item!
msg_ui_tips_LETSGO_01_text_03:
When your Pokémon starts a battle while exploring
on its own, you won’t need to give any orders.
It can battle on its own with [VAR COLOR(0006)]Auto Battles[VAR COLOR(0000)], meaning
that you can keep searching the area for new
discoveries while watching over it from nearby.
msg_ui_tips_LETSGO_01_text_04:
Auto Battles will be decided by the [VAR COLOR(0006)]strength [VAR COLOR(0000)]and
the [VAR COLOR(0006)]types [VAR COLOR(0000)]of the Pokémon taking part in the battle,
so keep that in mind when you’re choosing which
of your Pokémon to send out on its own!
msg_ui_tips_TREASUREHUNT_01_text_01:
The [VAR COLOR(0006)]Treasure Hunt[VAR COLOR(0000)] has finally begun! This special
event is held by the academy to encourage students
to set out on their own and learn for themselves.
You’re free to decide where you want to go
as you search for a treasure all your own!
msg_ui_tips_DESTINATION_01_text_01:
When you don’t know where to go next, you can ask
for help at any [VAR COLOR(0006)]Pokémon Center[VAR COLOR(0000)]. The staff there can
give you [VAR COLOR(0006)]tips[VAR COLOR(0000)] about where you might want to try.
Plus, they’ll register their suggested destinations
on your Rotom Phone for you.
msg_ui_tips_CROSSKEY_01_text_01:
There are all kinds of handy functions registered
to your directional buttons. Check them out!

[VAR COLOR(0006)]↑ Use emotes  [VAR COLOR(0000)]/  [VAR COLOR(0006)]↓ Open camera app
← Change outfit or look [VAR COLOR(0000)]/  [VAR COLOR(0006)]→ Check notices[VAR COLOR(0000)]
msg_ui_tips_LOCKON_01_text_01:
If you press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]ZL Button[VAR COLOR(0000)], you can [VAR COLOR(0006)]lock on [VAR COLOR(0000)]to a
nearby Pokémon—meaning you’ll keep your sights
set on it. Once you’re locked on, throwing a Poké
Ball with the [VAR COLOR(0006)]ZR Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] will let you start a battle
with the Pokémon you were aiming for.
msg_ui_tips_QUICKRECOVERY_01_text_01:
The Auto Heal feature will automatically select items
from your Bag and use them to heal your Pokémon.
To use Auto Heal, highlight the Pokémon you want to
heal from the main menu and press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]− Button[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_QUICKRECOVERY_01_text_02:
[VAR COLOR(0006)]Auto Heal will use up items in the following order:[VAR COLOR(0000)]
1. Potions
2. Fresh Waters
3. Soda Pops
4. Super Potions
5. Lemonades
6. Moomoo Milks
7. Hyper Potions
msg_ui_tips_HIDEWALK_01_text_01:
You can use the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to crouch. When you’re
crouched down low in tall grass, it will become
[VAR COLOR(0006)]harder for wild Pokémon to notice you[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_HIDEWALK_01_text_02:
If you can get close to a Pokémon without it noticing
you and then [VAR COLOR(0006)]throw a Poké Ball[VAR COLOR(0000)] using the ZR Button,
you can [VAR COLOR(0006)]catch it off guard[VAR COLOR(0000)]. You’ll be able to act first
in the battle, giving you a nice advantage!
msg_ui_tips_POKERUSH_01_text_01:
You may sometimes see [VAR COLOR(0006)]Pokémon icons[VAR COLOR(0000)] on your map.
When you do, it means you [VAR COLOR(0006)]may be able to find those[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]Pokémon[VAR COLOR(0000)] in that area, so try to search them out!
msg_ui_tips_WAZAREMEMBER_01_text_01:
If Pokémon skip learning moves or forget old moves,
they can learn them again! Open the [VAR COLOR(0006)]main menu[VAR COLOR(0000)],
select a Pokémon, then select [VAR COLOR(0006)]Check summary[VAR COLOR(0000)]. On the
status screen, go to the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Moves and Stats[VAR COLOR(0000)] tab to check
your Pokémon’s moves and help it [VAR COLOR(0006)]remember[VAR COLOR(0000)] some!
msg_ui_tips_UNIONCIRCLE_01_text_01:
Using the Union Circle, you can [VAR COLOR(0006)]play together[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]with friends[VAR COLOR(0000)] as you adventure around Paldea!
msg_ui_tips_UNIONCIRCLE_01_text_02:
If you want to play with [VAR COLOR(0006)]nearby friends[VAR COLOR(0000)], you should
leave your internet connection in [VAR COLOR(0006)]Offline Mode[VAR COLOR(0000)].
If you want to play with [VAR COLOR(0006)]faraway friends[VAR COLOR(0000)], change
to [VAR COLOR(0006)]Online Mode[VAR COLOR(0000)]. You can connect to or disconnect
from the internet from within the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Poké Portal[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_UNIONCIRCLE_01_text_03:
When you want to invite friends to play
together with you, form a group and then
[VAR COLOR(0006)]tell your friends the Link Code you set[VAR COLOR(0000)].
When you want to join a friend’s group, you’ll
need to [VAR COLOR(0006)]enter the Link Code they share with you[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_UNIONCIRCLE_01_text_04:
Just remember that you won’t be able to take part
in [VAR COLOR(0006)]Link Battles[VAR COLOR(0000)], [VAR COLOR(0006)]Link Trades[VAR COLOR(0000)], or [VAR COLOR(0006)]Tera Raid Battles[VAR COLOR(0000)]
with anyone but your fellow group members
while you’re playing together as a group.
msg_ui_tips_TTYPE_01_text_01:
Here in the Paldea region, Pokémon can crystallize
through a strange phenomenon. The people call this
[VAR COLOR(0006)]Terastallizing[VAR COLOR(0000)]. You can Terastallize your Pokémon by
selecting the [VAR COLOR(0006)]TERASTALLIZE! [VAR COLOR(0000)]button in battle.
msg_ui_tips_TTYPE_01_text_02:
When a Pokémon Terastallizes, its type changes to
its [VAR COLOR(0006)]Tera Type[VAR COLOR(0000)]. Moves of the same type as this Tera
Type will become much more powerful than usual.
msg_ui_tips_TTYPE_01_text_03:
After Terastallizing a Pokémon once, you [VAR COLOR(0006)]won’t be[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]able to Terastallize a Pokémon again until you heal[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]up at a Pokémon Center[VAR COLOR(0000)], so use this strategy wisely
to seize victory in battles!
msg_ui_tips_PHOTOMODE_01_text_01:
You can [VAR COLOR(0006)]start up the camera app[VAR COLOR(0000)] by pressing the
[VAR COLOR(0006)]Down Button[VAR COLOR(0000)]. Move the camera about freely to snap
shots of all kinds of places and Pokémon you see!
msg_ui_tips_PHOTOMODE_01_text_02:
When you have the camera app open, press the
[VAR COLOR(0006)]Y Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to flip the camera around and take photos of
yourself. Press it again to return the camera to normal.
msg_ui_tips_PHOTOMODE_01_text_03:
When you want to take fancy or funny photos,
try pressing the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Left Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] or the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Right Button[VAR COLOR(0000)]
to [VAR COLOR(0006)]change filters[VAR COLOR(0000)]!
msg_ui_tips_SHOPWAZAMACHINE_01_text_02:
To make TMs, you’ll need to gather up [VAR COLOR(0006)]materials[VAR COLOR(0000)]
from Pokémon and earn [VAR COLOR(0006)]League Points[VAR COLOR(0000)], or [VAR COLOR(0006)]LP[VAR COLOR(0000)].
The range of TMs you can make will expand as
you pick up new TMs or receive them from others
during your adventure.
msg_ui_tips_POKEPICNIC_01_text_01:
You can enjoy picnics together with the Pokémon
in your party. If you’re playing in a group with
friends through the Union Circle, you can also
have [VAR COLOR(0006)]picnics with friends[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_POKEPICNIC_01_text_02:
You won’t be able to set up a picnic table in the
middle of a town or where there isn’t enough space
to get everything out—or on inclines, where things
might go sliding off your table! Look for [VAR COLOR(0006)]wide-open,[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]level spots outside of towns[VAR COLOR(0000)] when you want to picnic!
msg_ui_tips_COOKING_01_title_02: What You Need to Make Sandwiches
msg_ui_tips_COOKING_01_text_01:
Try whipping up a delicious sandwich by piling your
favorite ingredients up on sliced bread.
If you’re picnicking with friends, you can take part in
sandwich prep together as well!
msg_ui_tips_COOKING_01_text_02:
The [VAR COLOR(0006)]sandwich ingredients[VAR COLOR(0000)] and [VAR COLOR(0006)]sandwich picks
[VAR COLOR(0000)]you need to put together a great sandwich can
be [VAR COLOR(0006)]bought [VAR COLOR(0000)]at various shops found in towns and
cities. Stock up on your favorite ingredients
and picks, and see what you can create.
msg_ui_tips_COOKING_01_text_03:
In [VAR COLOR(0006)]Recipe Mode[VAR COLOR(0000)], ingredients are selected for you. All
you have to do is skillfully arrange them on the bread
to make the sandwich in the recipe. But if you drop
an ingredient and don’t get everything the recipe calls
for, you may end up making something different.
msg_ui_tips_COOKING_01_text_04:
Dig into a nice meal at a restaurant or picnic, and you
and your Pokémon can gain [VAR COLOR(0006)]Meal Powers[VAR COLOR(0000)]. Many
Meal Powers have an associated type, meaning they’ll
only affect Pokémon of that type. The effects of a
Meal Power will be impacted by [VAR COLOR(0006)]what’s in a given dish[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_COOKING_01_text_05:
･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Egg Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More likely to find Pokémon Eggs
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Catching Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More likely catches will succeed
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Exp. Point Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More Exp. Points gained
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Item Drop Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More materials found after battle
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Raid Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More rewards from Tera Raid Battles
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Title Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More likely to find Pokémon with titles
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Sparkling Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More likely to find Shiny Pokémon
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Humungo Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More likely to find large Pokémon
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Teensy Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More likely to find small Pokémon
 ･ [VAR COLOR(0006)]Encounter Power[VAR COLOR(0000)]: More likely to find certain types
msg_ui_tips_POKEWASH_01_text_01:
When your Pokémon get dirty, you can give them
a nice [VAR COLOR(0006)]wash [VAR COLOR(0000)]to have them looking fresh and clean.
Doing so can have all kinds of nice benefits,
including [VAR COLOR(0006)]restoring their HP[VAR COLOR(0000)] or making them
feel [VAR COLOR(0006)]more friendly [VAR COLOR(0000)]toward you.
msg_ui_tips_LEAGUCARD_01_text_01:
If you select your [VAR COLOR(0006)]Profile[VAR COLOR(0000)] from the map app, you’ll
find various [VAR COLOR(0006)]records from your adventure[VAR COLOR(0000)]. You can
also check your [VAR COLOR(0006)]profile picture and Trainer icon[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_LEAGUCARD_01_text_02:
Both your [VAR COLOR(0006)]profile picture[VAR COLOR(0000)] and your [VAR COLOR(0006)]Trainer icon[VAR COLOR(0000)] can be
[VAR COLOR(0006)]updated [VAR COLOR(0000)]freely by taking photos with the camera app.
Enjoy crafting a profile that’s all your own!
msg_ui_tips_RAIDSPOT_01_text_01:
All around Paldea, you may spot gleaming [VAR COLOR(0006)]crystals[VAR COLOR(0000)]
emitting brilliant beams of light. If you investigate
one, you’ll be able to take on a [VAR COLOR(0006)]Tera Raid Battle[VAR COLOR(0000)]
and try to defeat a powerful Tera Pokémon.
msg_ui_tips_RAIDBATTLE_01_text_01:
In Tera Raid Battles, you’ll work together with
other Trainers to battle [VAR COLOR(0006)]powerful Tera Pokémon[VAR COLOR(0000)].
You can battle alongside [VAR COLOR(0006)]faraway[VAR COLOR(0000)] friends while
you’re in [VAR COLOR(0006)]Online Mode[VAR COLOR(0000)] or [VAR COLOR(0006)]nearby[VAR COLOR(0000)] friends while
you’re in [VAR COLOR(0006)]Offline Mode[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_RAIDBATTLE_01_text_02:
These battles will pit you against Tera Pokémon with
[VAR COLOR(0006)]rare Tera Types[VAR COLOR(0000)]. If you and your allies can work
together to defeat the Tera Pokémon, you’ll have
a chance to [VAR COLOR(0006)]catch[VAR COLOR(0000)] it and also get [VAR COLOR(0006)]special items[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_RAIDBATTLE_02_list: The Rules of Tera Raid Battles
msg_ui_tips_RAIDBATTLE_02_title_01: The Rules of Tera Raid Battles
msg_ui_tips_RAIDBATTLE_02_text_01:
In a Tera Raid Battle, you’ll try to defeat a Tera
Pokémon within a time limit. If your Pokémon is
knocked out, it will [VAR COLOR(0006)]be revived[VAR COLOR(0000)] after a while—but
you’ll also [VAR COLOR(0006)]take a time penalty[VAR COLOR(0000)], so try to avoid
letting your Pokémon faint, if you can!
msg_ui_tips_RAIDBATTLE_02_text_02:
You can also perform a special action in Tera Raid
Battles: [VAR COLOR(0006)]cheering[VAR COLOR(0000)]! By cheering for your side, you
can do things like boosting the stats of the Pokémon
on your side or helping them recover their health.
You can perform cheers three times per battle.
msg_ui_tips_DANBATTLE_01_text_01:
Send your Pokémon out with the [VAR COLOR(0006)]R Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to try
to defeat [VAR COLOR(0006)]a set number[VAR COLOR(0000)] of Team Star’s Pokémon
before time runs out! When you’re taking on
the challenge of a Star Barrage, you can have
[VAR COLOR(0006)]three Pokémon [VAR COLOR(0000)]out at the same time.
msg_ui_tips_DANBATTLE_01_text_02:
You lose in a Star Barrage if all your Pokémon
get too worn out to battle or if [VAR COLOR(0006)]time runs out[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_DANBATTLE_01_text_03:
If one of your Pokémon can no longer battle, you
can help it [VAR COLOR(0006)]recover HP[VAR COLOR(0000)] by using a [VAR COLOR(0006)]vending machine[VAR COLOR(0000)].

If you decide you want to [VAR COLOR(0006)]give up[VAR COLOR(0000)] before
time runs out, press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Y Button[VAR COLOR(0000)].
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_02_text_01:
In Casual Battles, you can enjoy battling
with all kinds of Trainers from all over
the world without too much pressure.
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_02_text_02:
When you want to take part in a Casual Battle, make
sure that [VAR COLOR(0006)]all the Pokémon on your Battle Team[VAR COLOR(0000)] are of
a [VAR COLOR(0006)]different species[VAR COLOR(0000)].

Make sure that no Pokémon on your Battle Team are
holding the [VAR COLOR(0006)]same item[VAR COLOR(0000)]. They all have to be different!

Beyond these rules, there are no restrictions on what
Pokémon can take part in a Casual Battle.
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_03_text_01:
Ranked Battles allow you to battle against
other Trainers around the world to see
who can reach the highest rank.
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_03_text_02:
If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]win[VAR COLOR(0000)] in Ranked Battles, you can go up in rank.

Try your hardest to see how high a rank you can
reach before each battle season ends!
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_03_text_03:
The highest rank you can reach is called [VAR COLOR(0006)]MAX RANK[VAR COLOR(0000)].
Once you reach this rank, you’ll battle to decide
[VAR COLOR(0006)]your place [VAR COLOR(0000)]within that lofty group. Try to reach the
highest place you can before the season’s end!
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_03_text_04:
The Pokémon that can take part in Ranked Battles
may change [VAR COLOR(0006)]with each season[VAR COLOR(0000)].

Look for [VAR COLOR(0006)]news[VAR COLOR(0000)] shared in the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Poké Portal[VAR COLOR(0000)] to learn more
about current or upcoming rules.
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_04_text_01:
In Online Competitions, you battle other Trainers
to try to reach first place. You’ll earn yourself
a rating, which goes up when you win battles.
In order to take part in any competition, you’ll
have to register to [VAR COLOR(0006)]enter the competition[VAR COLOR(0000)] first!
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_04_text_02:
With [VAR COLOR(0006)]Friendly Competitions[VAR COLOR(0000)], any player can start up
their [VAR COLOR(0006)]very own competition[VAR COLOR(0000)] and decide how long it
will be held and what the rules are.
By sharing the competition ID with your friends,
you can all enjoy battling together!
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_04_text_03:
You can also take part in [VAR COLOR(0006)]Official Competitions[VAR COLOR(0000)]—
[VAR COLOR(0006)]special competitions [VAR COLOR(0000)]with specific, preset rules.
These competitions’ schedules and rules are
published on the official Pokémon website.
msg_ui_tips_BATTLESTADIUM_04_text_04:
To take part in a competition, you’ll need to
complete an official [VAR COLOR(0006)]entry[VAR COLOR(0000)]. You’ll also need to
[VAR COLOR(0006)]register your Battle Team[VAR COLOR(0000)] at the same time.
msg_ui_tips_MYSTERY_01_text_01:
With a Surprise Trade, you don’t choose who you’ll
trade with or what you’ll get. Just choose a Pokémon
you’re willing to part with from your Boxes, and your
trade will be carried out [VAR COLOR(0006)]automatically[VAR COLOR(0000)]. You’ll need
an [VAR COLOR(0006)]internet connection[VAR COLOR(0000)] to use this feature.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEON_01_text_01:
Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]+ Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to jump onto Koraidon—
you’ll find you can get around more quickly.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEON_01_text_02:
When you’re on Koraidon’s back, you can press
the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to have it jump, allowing you to [VAR COLOR(0006)]leap[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]over obstacles[VAR COLOR(0000)] in your path. Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]+ Button[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]again [VAR COLOR(0000)]to get off of Koraidon and walk.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEON_02_text_01:
Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]+ Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to jump onto Miraidon—
you’ll find you can get around more quickly.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEON_02_text_02:
When you’re on Miraidon’s back, you can press
the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] to have it jump, allowing you to [VAR COLOR(0006)]leap[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]over obstacles[VAR COLOR(0000)] in your path. Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]+ Button[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]again [VAR COLOR(0000)]to get off of Miraidon and walk.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEDASH_01_text_01:
Now you can have Koraidon [VAR COLOR(0006)]dash[VAR COLOR(0000)] ahead by [VAR COLOR(0006)]pressing[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]the Left Stick[VAR COLOR(0000)]. But watch out for trees when dashing
at high speeds! If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]strike a tree [VAR COLOR(0000)]while dashing,
Pokémon lurking up among the branches will fall
down—allowing you to battle them.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEJUMP_01_text_01:
If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]press and hold the B Button[VAR COLOR(0000)], Koraidon
will now be able to jump higher than before.

If you give the B Button a [VAR COLOR(0006)]quick press[VAR COLOR(0000)],
it will perform a smaller jump instead.
msg_ui_tips_RIDECLIMB_01_text_01:
If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]press the B Button to jump while facing a wall[VAR COLOR(0000)],
Koraidon will grab on to it, allowing you to climb up
vertical surfaces. You can move in any direction you
like while climbing by using the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Left Stick[VAR COLOR(0000)]. To let go
of a wall, just press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] once more.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEGLID_01_text_01:
Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button when you’re in the air[VAR COLOR(0000)],
and Koraidon will now [VAR COLOR(0006)]glide[VAR COLOR(0000)] for you. If you
press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button once more[VAR COLOR(0000)], you’ll stop
gliding and immediately start falling!
msg_ui_tips_RIDEFLOAT_01_text_01:
Koraidon can now [VAR COLOR(0006)]move across bodies of water[VAR COLOR(0000)],
opening up new ways to get around.

If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]press the B Button while you’re on the water[VAR COLOR(0000)],
Koraidon can even jump.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEDASH_02_text_01:
Now you can have Miraidon [VAR COLOR(0006)]dash[VAR COLOR(0000)] ahead by [VAR COLOR(0006)]pressing[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]the Left Stick[VAR COLOR(0000)]. But watch out for trees when dashing
at high speeds! If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]strike a tree [VAR COLOR(0000)]while dashing,
Pokémon lurking up among the branches will fall
down—allowing you to battle them.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEJUMP_02_text_01:
If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]press and hold the B Button[VAR COLOR(0000)], Miraidon
will now be able to jump higher than before.

If you give the B Button a [VAR COLOR(0006)]quick press[VAR COLOR(0000)],
it will perform a smaller jump instead.
msg_ui_tips_RIDECLIMB_02_text_01:
If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]press the B Button to jump while facing a wall[VAR COLOR(0000)],
Miraidon will grab on to it, allowing you to climb up
vertical surfaces. You can move in any direction you
like while climbing by using the [VAR COLOR(0006)]Left Stick[VAR COLOR(0000)]. To let go
of a wall, just press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button[VAR COLOR(0000)] once more.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEGLID_02_text_01:
Press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button when you’re in the air[VAR COLOR(0000)],
and Miraidon will now [VAR COLOR(0006)]glide[VAR COLOR(0000)] for you. If you
press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]B Button once more[VAR COLOR(0000)], you’ll stop
gliding and immediately start falling!
msg_ui_tips_RIDEFLOAT_02_text_01:
Miraidon can now [VAR COLOR(0006)]move across bodies of water[VAR COLOR(0000)],
opening up new ways to get around.

If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]press the B Button while you’re on the water[VAR COLOR(0000)],
Miraidon can even jump.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEFORM_01_text_01:
If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]select Koraidon [VAR COLOR(0000)]while the main menu is open,
you can now have it change between its battle form
and its ride form.
msg_ui_tips_RIDEFORM_02_text_01:
If you [VAR COLOR(0006)]select Miraidon [VAR COLOR(0000)]while the main menu is open,
you can now have it change between its battle form
and its ride form.
msg_ui_tips_RENTALTEAM_01_text_01:
Rental Teams offer you a way to [VAR COLOR(0006)]borrow
[VAR COLOR(0000)]the Battle Teams that other Trainers have
put together and shared online.

They also allow you to do the same—you can share
your Battle Teams to [VAR COLOR(0006)]let others try them out[VAR COLOR(0000)].

When you choose to make a Battle Team public,
a [VAR COLOR(0006)]team ID[VAR COLOR(0000)] will be displayed. Anyone who knows the
ID can use it to search for and borrow that team!
msg_ui_tips_TSYMBOL_01_title_01: How to Catch Wild Tera Pokémon
msg_ui_tips_TSYMBOL_01_text_01:
You cannot catch a Pokémon while it’s Terastallized.

You’ll need to [VAR COLOR(0006)]reduce its HP[VAR COLOR(0000)] to [VAR COLOR(0006)]break through its[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]transformation[VAR COLOR(0000)] first—only then can you try to catch it.
msg_ui_tips_GSRULE_01_text_01:
Among the various rule sets for battle, there’s a
particularly unique set called the GS Cup Rules.
When you see these rules on offer, know that they
allow you to battle with some special Pokémon on
your Battle Team—but only certain ones and only
a certain number of them!
msg_ui_tips_POKETRADE_01_text_02:
You can trade Pokémon with your friends through
Link Trades. Get started by agreeing on a [VAR COLOR(0006)]Link Code[VAR COLOR(0000)]
with a friend. If you both enter the same Link Code,
you should be able to find each other!

When your internet connection is set to [VAR COLOR(0006)]Offline Mode[VAR COLOR(0000)],
you can only trade with [VAR COLOR(0006)]nearby[VAR COLOR(0000)] friends. When it’s set
to [VAR COLOR(0006)]Online Mode[VAR COLOR(0000)], you can trade with [VAR COLOR(0006)]faraway[VAR COLOR(0000)] friends.

Once you connect, you may see some Pokémon start
to glow in your Boxes. Try trading them to your friend!
msg_ui_tips_JUDGE_01_text_02:
While in your Boxes, you can press the [VAR COLOR(0006)]+ Button[VAR COLOR(0000)]
twice to navigate to and check the individual
[VAR COLOR(0006)]strengths [VAR COLOR(0000)]inherent to your Pokémon.
